poem:
"No Sun, Only Sunak"

Sunak
stands squint-eyed
amongst the furloughed fields—
a contradiction mirroring
the sun itself.

"Conspiracy," he speaks,
and winter shudders.
Yet spring endures,
blooming with nettles and nettling insight.

Hear not the drone of
pandering extremists, 
instead, let the wheat bow
only to the wind's truth.

Oh Sunak,
a harvest of reason awaits,
should you withstand 
the season's shifting spool.
